Wow, if you can actually do this Anfernio, I’d be happy to join your server Watched the sounds video, yeh, you need to fix that lol. And what’s up with the client? The Sprites are out of order, hanging off xD Sounds good though… You know if you release this when you’re done, everyone gonna leach you lol… Great job though!
[/quote]

Lol, I fixed that. Got tired of my fail 317 look-a-like. :([/quote]

Yeh, I like the basic gameframe better than the newer ones, reminds me of old Runescape (which ruleD until the stupid updates in 2008… Good luck though, hope it turns out awsomeness

item.title: Project Anfernio
item.dc:creator: @Anfernio Anfernio
item.description:
@Anfernio wrote:

This is my newest project, it will be based on DeltaScape.
I’ll try to update every time I get a chance.

Credits:
Delta_
JaydenD12 (Jayden ftw. :D)
Anfernio (Anthony)
Whoever made the source I’m using. (Only wanted donator st00f. >_>)

First off, we have the cannon.
Jayden and I have been developing this cannon.
The cannon can spin.
You can pick up any piece of the cannon, and combo’d parts of the cannons. Ex: Cannon Base and stand.
Cannot logout while ANY piece of the cannon is set-up.
Cannot set-up a piece of the cannon out of place.
Cannon attacks any npc within 3 steps.
The spawning a new cannon bug is fixed.
Video: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=RIUb6r8dFFc

Sounds on certain things.
I’ve added sounds onto common things. If anyone would like the code, let me know. Anyway, I’m working on fixing the playing before the action has started.
Video: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Xhu44inOAoY

Tried working so it displays the day/month on login without me updating everytime. Codes atm:

[code]public void months() {
int month = 5;
if(month == 1)
System.out.println(“January”);
if(month == 2)
System.out.println(“February”);
if (month == 3)
System.out.println(“March”);
if(month == 4)
System.out.println(“April”);
if(month == 5)
System.out.println(“May”);
}
public void months2() {

    int month = 2;
    int year = 2009;
    int numDays = 0;

    switch (month) {
        case 1:
        case 3:
        case 5:
            numDays = 31;
            break;
        case 4:
            numDays = 30;
            break;
        case 2:
            if ( ((year % 4 == 0) && !(year % 100 == 0))
                 || (year % 400 == 0) )
                numDays = 30;
            else
                numDays = 31;
            break;
        default:
            System.out.println("Invalid month.");
            break;
    }
    System.out.println("Number of Days = " + numDays);
}[/code]

Sorted the files. Extra files are handled in a different file, and the main source handled in a different folder.

Wrote a failed mini-quest for the Fourth of July.

Read full topic
